intro: Chaerophyllum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf hogweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some poisonous species. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
